page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
The communities of Hope and Caergwrle have a long history, dating back some 6000 years. The villages are located just 4 miles from the English border and yet retain a strong Welsh identity. Another remarkable feature of these settlements is that they have managed to keep a strong sense of community feeling. {(Local history)
Hope and Caergwrle are to be found in a beautiful setting, located at the foot of Hope Mountain, from where the Cheshire Plain and Merseyside are clearly visible. Caergwrle used to act as a magnet for surrounding areas on account of its famous spa waters but by 1985, along with Hope, it has become a dormitory area with many of its inhabitants finding employment in Wrexham, Chester, Mold, Deeside and Merseyside. {(Landscape)}
